lines.line: Ah, an adventurer. Could you spare some of your time to help me?
Why, what's the matter?
It's a sorry tale. I was once an accomplished sculptor, you see.
I made statues for the kings, queens and rulers of Gielinor. But then there was the accident...
After that, I could never hold a chisel again.
But I have been struck by my muse while travelling the desert, and want nothing more than to build a statue in this area.
The desert's plain and full of sand, and needs more decoration.
So, what would you need my help with?
As I said, I can't hold a chisel, but I can guide you in crafting the statue for me.
I'd need you to quarry the stone for it, as well.
Well, will you help me with my art?
Of course!
You'll have to explain it to me as you go along, but count me in.
Excellent.
What should I be doing to make your statue?
There is a stone quarry nearby; I require several blocks of sandstone in order to make the statue.
Each of these blocks should be around... well, let's say thirty two kilograms for the first one.
I can't mine a block that big!
Well, then, bring me enough smaller blocks to make thirty two kilograms, and I will deal with it.
So, how much do different blocks of sandstone weigh?
From what the last adventurer told me, there are tiny blocks that weigh 1 kg, small blocks that weigh 2 kg, and medium-sized blocks that weigh 5 kg.
There are also large blocks that weigh 10 kg, but I doubt a weedy adventurer like you could even carry one, let alone mine one cleanly.
Apparently, the more skilled you are at mining, the larger the blocks you can chip off the rock.
Okay, I'll get on with it.
I don't know, that sounds like a lot of work.
All true art requires work.
I have some sandstone for you!
Well, hand it over, then.
That makes kg I'm carrying now.
I'm now carrying kg of your inexpertly-quarried stone.
That's kg I have now.
I need kg more stone to make the base. Any more stone you want to burden me down with?
I need kg more stone to make the base. Have you any more to make me carry?
I need kg more stone to make the base. Do you have any more stone you want to offload onto me?
Yes, I have more stone.
Here's a large 10 kg block.
Thank you, adventurer.
Here's a medium 5 kg block.
Oh, joy. I'm sure I'll treasure it.
Here's a small 2 kg block.
So generous of you, adventurer.
Here's a tiny 1 kg block.
Either you've been splitting stone into smaller blocks, or you're worse at quarrying stone than I expected.
Why won't you take more than 32 kg of stone?
Because, adventurer, I'm not going to carry more of your blocks than I absolutely must.
If your blocks are too big, break them with a chisel or a pick.
That's enough for the base of the statue, certainly.
Here you are, adventurer. Now, use a chisel to craft it into a base for the statue.
How am I supposed to carry that? It's huge!
Oh, stop whining. The last adventurer who helped me was carrying around a girl in a barrel.
Zamorak only knows why, but didn't complain.
No, that's all for now.
I have this large block of sandstone you gave me...
I told you to carve it into the base of the statue, correct?
Yes, you did.
Then why are you standing around brainlessly? Get on with it!
I've made the base of the statue!
Excellent. Now, just put it on the flat ground next to me.
What do you want me to do now?
Hmph. Well, the base of the statue is done, but it needs a body. Twenty kilograms should be enough for you to make it.
I'll do it right away!
I need kg more stone to make the body. Any more stone you want to burden me down with?
I need kg more stone to make the body. Have you any more to make me carry?
I need kg more stone to make the body. Do you have any more stone you want to offload onto me?
That should be enough to use for the statue's body.
All you have to do with it, adventurer, is chisel it into the body of the statue.
I have this large block of sandstone you gave me.
Very nice, adventurer. You're supposed to make it into the statue's body.
Get your chisel ready and start working.
I've made the statue's body!
Well done, adventurer. Not as dense as you look.
Go on, add it to the base of the statue.
You utter incompetent! Have you added the body to the statue yet?
Of course I have!
Hmm, then perhaps I'm still missing something...
What do you want me to do next?
Oh, I don't know, adventurer. Go and chisel the statue a bit more, or something.
Okay then.
It shouldn't have taken this long... did I miscalculate?
Ah, adventurer. As you can see, the statue is nearly complete. All it needs is a head.
The head should be made out of granite, which you can find in that quarry nearby.
As for whose head... well, perhaps I'll let you impose your own artistic vision on it.
Whose head do you think should be on the statue?
I think it should have my head!
Are you mad?
You'd start carving it, then you'd take a helmet off or change your hairstyle, and nobody would know who on Gielinor it was supposed to be!
Statues are far more permanent than you adventurers and your fashions.
So I can't put my head on the statue?
No. Now choose something sensible.
I think it should have your head.
After all, it's your statue.
Why, that's very generous of you, adventurer.
Are you hoping for a bigger reward for saying that?
Er, maybe.
Wonderful. Well, at least you have me here for reference.
Now, go and find a suitable block of granite and make that head.
And do try to remember which one it is you're carving.
I think it should have a god's head.
I see...
And which god were you thinking of? There's very little reference material here in the desert.
That's true.
Whose head do you think I should make?
Well, some of the people in the desert worship a god called Icthlarin.
Or, if you prefer, I'm sure you could sculpt Zamorak instead.
I'll use Zamorak's head for the statue.
Ah, an excellent choice.
Now you should find a suitable block of granite, and make that head.
Try to remember which head you've decided to carve - I know you adventurers. Memories like fishing nets.
I'll use Icthlarin's head for the statue.
An interesting choice - I'm sure there's some reference material you can use around here.
Find a suitable block of granite, and get carving.
And make sure to remember which one you're supposed to be carving. I've known some of you adventurers to forget things you were told three seconds ago.
A human statue with a camel's head? Is there any particular reason?
Er, no. I just thought it would be funny.
Well, it is appropriate, all things considered...
Very well, it'll work well in a desert setting. Now, find a suitable block of granite, and carve that head.
Make sure you remember which head you're carving. The last adventurer who tried to help me forgot half- way through carving, and produced the strangest mixture of camel and human I've ever seen.
You know, I've done something like this before.
I had to help rebuild a statue in the city of Keldagrim, and then choose whose head should be placed on the top!
Keldagrim? Hmph. Technically good sculptors, the dwarves, but they have no sense of art.
I'm sure that none of them would even think of travelling to the desert and building a statue here.
Can I use the head I chose for that statue on yours?
Do you even remember what it looked like?
Er... no.
Then no, you can't. Now, choose something else.
Hmm. Which head did I decide to use for the statue?
There, that looks good.
Was it supposed to look like that?
I have a head for the statue, but...
I'm not sure it's the right one.
Let me see...
You decided to make the statue's head look like me, you said.
Hmm. I don't think much of your artistic skills, adventurer, but it's a passable likeness.
...You really have a shorter attention span than a grain of sand, don't you?
You said you'd make the statue's head look like me, not like modern art!
I'm sorry, I'll remember next time.
Perhaps it was too difficult for you. Do you want to change what head you'll make?
No, I'll stay with the one I chose first.
Fair enough. Remember, you're carving my head for the statue.
Yes, I'd like to change my choice.
Well, which will you choose this time?
You said you'd make the statue's head look like Zamorak.
Hmm. You're not a particularly good sculptor, adventurer, but it's at least recognisable.
Do you even remember who you were supposed be carving?
It was supposed to be Zamorak, not the horrific monstrosity you've carved!
But I thought that was what he looked like.
How dare you?
Ahem, that is to say, er...
Well, it was obviously too tough for you. Do you want to change what head you'll make?
Well, you said that you'd make the statue's head look like Icthlarin.
You're not much of an artist, but at least you did your research. It'll pass.
Weren't you supposed to be carving Icthlarin's head?
...I was?
Well, you're paying lots of attention, aren't you? Honestly, you adventurers.
It would be easier on your poor little brain if you changed what head you'll make, don't you agree?
You said you'd make the statue's head look like a camel, and that looks like...
Well, it wouldn't fool a camel, but it's close enough for the statue.
I don't believe it. You said you were planning to make a camel head, but what's this?
Er, not a camel head?
Correct, adventurer! Have a cake.
Really?
Of course not! Why would I give something to you for having a worse memory than a piece of burnt fish?
Do you want to change what head you'll make to something you have a chance of remembering?
Hold it! I know you adventurers.
I bet you've managed to make the wrong head, or something like that.
I know what I'm doing, honest...
I don't care if you think you know what you're doing. Let me have a look at that head.
Fine, fine...
What's going on?
Ow!
Ouch!
Argh, my duodenum!
Ow... Lazim has some explaining to do!
Ah, excellent, it's all gone as planned.
Gone as planned?
We just fell through the ground into some weird temple!
Of course we did! That's why I had you build a statue.
I don't think you really are a sculptor. What are you looking for in this temple?
Oh, nothing. No treasure here. No priceless artefacts from the lost ages of Gielinor, or anything like that.
I'll be leaving, then.
Wait! If you help me, then...
I'll give you a share of whatever we find.
That sounds better. So, where's the treasure?
At the top of the temple. We've fallen through to the very bottom, so you'll have to climb up to the next floor.
That's good, but...
How do I get further into the temple?
The stories I've heard say there are odd doors in this temple, that have locks that don't need keys, but... rather large limbs.
Yuck!
You can use your chisel or pick to take them from the statue. They should be the right size.
Be thankful they're the statue's limbs and not yours, adventurer.
Do you know where the statue's head is?
Ah, it fell off when the statue dropped through the ceiling. I've been keeping it safe since then.
Try not to lose it, adventurer.
You didn't get far from here before you mislaid it.
This time, try not to drop it.
...You're carrying it, adventurer.
Been at the Asgarnian Ale a little too much, have we?
Could you make these stone limbs easier to carry?
They're really heavy, and they weigh me down.
Of course not! I'm not a carnival conjurer.
Adversity builds character, adventurer. Heft them around by yourself.
Oh, okay.
I mislaid the statue's right arm.
I suppose I'm useful to have around at these times. I found it when you dropped it around here.
I can't find the statue's left arm.
It's lucky for you that I notice these things. Here, you managed to drop it in this room.
Er... I don't know where I put the statue's left leg.
You dropped it near the statue. Do I have to hold your hand through everything?
Here it is.
I lost the statue's right leg.
Well, it didn't go far - I found it in here. Take better care of it next time.
Ow, my head...
At last, it's complete. A temple fit for my lord.
All right, men, destroy that evil sorceress... and her temple with her!
You will never have this temple - it belongs to my lord!
F-for Avarrocka!
Ah ha ha ha ha!
Aaaaaargh!
Well, why would Zamorak want a temple? You said he needed weapons instead.
I wish I'd never supported him.
So you've seen sense? You'll join our side?
Of course.
Heh heh heh...
Surely this would make a good weapon...
No, no! Curse it, that doesn't work!
Can you help me with this pedestal I've found?
What pedestal?
It's on the floor above this. It looks sort of important.
Really? Did it have some sort of recess on the top?
Now that you mention it, it did...
In that case, perhaps you should try using the head of the statue on it.
Yes, and I tried using the statue's head with it...
...but it didn't fit properly.
Hmm. Intriguing, adventurer.
Perhaps you should find out what shape the recess is, so you can sculpt something that will fit in it.
Are you sure that will work?
Adventurer, I know more about this temple than you do.
All you need to do is make a mould of the recess somehow, then use it as a guide to make another head.
It should be made from the same granite as the statue's head was.
Ow, not another headache...
But it's still a nice temple, isn't it?
Wait... What is this?
Ha ha ha. You believed me, didn't you?
I would never desert my lord!
Well done unlocking those doors, adventurer. Did you have any problems?
I saw some really strange visions. Everything went grey...
Those are some of the traps to keep people away from this temple.
Thankfully, they didn't send you mad this time.
That doesn't sound good.
So, are we at the top of the temple now?
No, there is another floor above this. You have to go up a ladder in the room to the north.
Hah, that's easy. Treasure, here I come!
There's a magic barrier in the way. And right now, it won't let anything through.
Oh...
Is there any other way to get upstairs?
No, but I suspect the other rooms on this floor have magical properties. If you solve all the puzzles they present, then...
How will I know when I've solved them?
Oh, it'll be quite obvious.
The globes on the pedestal here will also light when you've solved the room they correspond to.
Have you come to torture me again?
What?
Oh, you may look human, but I know you're not. I've heard stories.
How you Mahjarrat can take on any form, and use magic to inflict pain without any weapons.
I, er... what?
I have no idea what you're talking about, but I'm just as human as you are.
You'll never get what you want from me. I'm a soldier of Avarrocka, and will stand strong!
Look, I'm not going to hurt you!
Besides, I am already wounded, and have been so for many years, thanks to this spell you cast on me. And hungry. So very, very hungry.
I've got some food you can have. It's quite tasty.
Here, try this. It should fill you up.
Have some of this food. It's really good, I promise!
My daughter was learning to cook this when I left.
I haven't remembered her in so long... thank you for reminding me of her.
My son loved this dish. He would have eaten it every day if we had let him.
I haven't remembered him in so long... thank you for reminding me of him.
A cake? There's nothing to celebrate, is there?
So many years gone by. My children must have grown up and left home.
I haven't remembered them in so long... thank you for reminding me of them.
Did you just dig that up and throw it into an oven?
It doesn't look good at all.
I'd prefer it with some sort of topping...
That doesn't look too bad at all.
It could almost be my wife's wonderful cooking.
What do you take me for? A rabbit?
What's this? Did you just dig it out of the ground?
What do you think I am, a bear? It's not even seasoned!
I'm a civilised man, not a barbarian gnawing on his kill!
Oh, how pleasant. I'm surprised you remembered to cook it after you killed it!
I'm hungry, but not so hungry that I'll eat your leftovers.
That's revolting! Why would you give people food you've already eaten half of?
I'm not touching that!
I might have enjoyed that food if you hadn't already eaten part of it.
So, you're throwing scraps of food to me like I'm a dog, are you?
If only you could feel the bite of my sword!
Do you think I'm a gnome, or something? I'm not going to eat that!
What are you trying to feed me? I don't want that!
Are you just trying to feed me everything you have?
What do you take me for? A goat who'll eat whatever's in front of him?
What are you trying to do, kill me?
Oh, I get it, you're experimenting on me with different things to see what I'll eat.
I'm not going to eat something your cat dragged in!
I'd rather have some good human home baking.
Some fresh home baking would be delicious.
I'd like something that's had some care put into making it.
I'd like to have a hearty meal fresh from the oven.
Are you feeling better now?
Yes, thank you.
The food you gave me healed my wounds, and it also reminded me of my family; that helped me to remember who I was.
I'm afraid that I'm trapped here, but I still remember something of this floor of the temple.
If you need any hints about the rooms nearby, I can give you some help.
When we came to the temple, that fountain was frosted with ice.
Even chipping at it with swords or lighting fires under it didn't do anything.
My guess is that some sort of magic is keeping it that way.
Tell me about the room with the furnace.
I tried to go in there, but the smoke was so thick I could barely see the furnace.
It may be that it's blocked, in which case you'll have to clear it out.
A good breeze should do the trick.
Tell me about the dark room.
I never went in there myself, but I peered through the door.
There seemed to be fires of some sort all around the room, but they were burning low.
I'd imagine they've gone out by now.
It's okay, I don't need any help.
The treasure's up ahead, adventurer. Be careful of the traps.
What traps?
Oh, I don't know. Perhaps, say, huge skeletons that'll tear your arms and legs off?
Nothing, adventurer, nothing. You just trot along and get that treasure, now.
Leave this temple at once, or I shall be forced to attack!
I will defend this door until I am released from this prison of bone...
You shall not pass me, unless I crumble into dust!
These bones that trap me will block your path!
Now, flee before I attack you!
Thank you, kind... now I am free from my imprisonment.
I no longer need these bones - take them, please, and bury what you can.
Don't interrupt me, human! I have to concentrate.
What are you doing?
I'm keeping a weapon under control. If my attention wavers...
...then it tries to escape me. I must keep it safe for my lord Zamorak.
Leave this place, before I am forced to attack!
If you value your life, young, then flee!
You should not be here! This is a dangerous place for beings such as you!
I am impressed, young. You seem to have more resilience than those I have fought off before.
Perhaps, then, you could help me with my predicament?
Why, what's wrong?
I am trapped in this form against my will... it has been a long and painful struggle to even regain control over my own mind.
Why did you attack me?
I didn't do anything to deserve it!
As I said, I am trapped like this against my will.
I am forced to defend the one who enslaved me from any harm, even though it disgusts me to do so!
Who's trapped you in this form?
SHE has. She was my rival before we came to this world, and supported that upstart Zamorak in his quest to be a god.
It angers me to think at how she tricked me into slavery...
Yes, I understand, but who is 'she'?
Her name is Enakhra, and she is the one who made this accursed temple and this boneguard that I am trapped in.
Now, since you show some interest in my situation, will you help me?
Of course, I'll help you out. But first of all, do you have any treasure?
I, er, was just wondering...
Certainly, young. If you help me, I will give you a valuable amulet, and some of my knowledge.
That's good enough for me. What do I have to do?
Enakhra keeps me trapped in this form with magic.
Her hold over me grew weaker over the years, and I began to build a wall to keep her trapped in her own temple forever.
Unfortunately, she has strengthened her spells lately, and I can no longer will myself to continue building.
I want you to finish building this wall, that we might seal her in this temple forever, where she cannot taint the world with her creations again.
About this wall...
Where do I get the stone?
There is a pile of rubble nearby, made of blocks that have fallen from the walls and the ceiling over time.
I have been trapped here for several thousand years, after all...
Is there anything else you wish to know?
How do I build the wall?
Since the blocks are heavy, you will need to be quite strong in order to lift them up to the wall.
Once you have placed the stones up on the wall, you must trim them with a chisel so that they do not fall off when you place the next layer.
How long will it take?
I was not far from finishing, I must say. It will most likely only take you three loads to finish building it.
Could you tell me more about Enakhra?
She is a coward, and a despicable traitor. She even supported Zamorak when he tried to become a god.
Of course, even though she built a temple for him, he didn't care, and she's been hiding here ever since.
Could you tell me more about yourself?
I was once a proud mage, and now look at me. Trapped inside a bone skeleton and forced to defend my rival's temple.
To think I believed her when she said she wanted to become allies and make amends for our rivalry!
That two-faced, conniving, backstabbing wretch...
I suppose it is our nature, after all.
Okay, I'll start building.
Thank you. Once you are finished, the wall itself will shield me from most of her magic, and I will be free to move once more.
So, you're determined to meddle in other people's business?
What do you mean?
That weapon has suddenly become a lot harder to control.
And I know it's your doing. He's tried to get you to help, hasn't he?
If you're talking about Akthanakos, then yes!
Of course, I don't suppose he's told you who he's trying to support, has he?
Er, no. But if you hate him so much, I suppose he doesn't support Zamorak...
How dare you throw around his name so casually?
No, Akthanakos never supported Zamorak. Not even after these thousands of years...
He has pledged his allegiance to someone much more foul.
Who?
...There are some names it is wiser not to mention, human.
Such as the name of my lord Zamorak, that you seem so fond of throwing around.
But you said 'Zamorak' first!
Out of my sight, you unworthy scum, before I rend your flesh from your bones.
Never dishonour his name again.
Okay...
Well, adventurer, do you have the treasure yet?
There doesn't seem to be any treasure there.
None at all?
Hmm... the big skeleton promised to give me something if I helped him.
Ah ha! So, it's not attacking you? Well done, adventurer. Your second brain cell must be working overtime today.
No! What have you done?
The wall's finally built!
Thank you. Thank you very much for all your help.
I can feel Enakhra's control over me fading. Finally, I can be free from this imprisonment...
After thousands of years... finally, I am no longer her slave.
Honour demands that I reward you... and yet you have no room to carry my reward. Please, return when you can take it from me.
As thanks for your help, young, please take this amulet of mine.
Wow. Er, what does it do?
It allows you to understand the speech of the Ugthanki, my patron animals, and other camels.
It is also bound to the desert, and can thus transport you back to this temple if you wish.
After so many years, why didn't you just give up?
Now my lord will punish you for destroying his weapon.
Ha ha... in that case, I'm sure lord Zaros will be happy to intervene.
I'll be waiting for you in the north, Akthanakos.
It'll be a pleasure to fight you once more...
Well, thank you, adventurer. You've just deprived me of a wonderful chance to learn from one of Zamorak's first followers.
What? What about that treasure you were looking for?
You utter imbecile! Did you think I was looking for gold?
I want knowledge!
Um... sorry.
'Sorry' won't bring those Mahjarrat back.
*sigh* I might as well stay to study this temple. It has some interesting magical properties.
Ooh, you're a mage? Can you teach me any spells?
Well...
I'm sure I've dropped hints the size of Varrock, but you might not have noticed. I'm a Zamorakian mage.
If you really want to learn my spells, you'll have to dedicate yourself to Zamorak.
I couldn't do that!
Then you won't be learning any of my spells.
Ha ha ha ha!
You're not very nice, are you?
What did you expect from a Zamorakian mage?
You really thought I would teach you my secrets just like that? Ha ha ha! You are a naive fool.
That's not very nice of you.
I'm a mage of Zamorak, after all. What else do you expect?
How are you and your defective brain doing nowadays, adventurer?
I've lost the amulet that Akthanakos gave me.
You scatterbrained fool. You dropped it in here. Since you have no space to carry it, I can't give it back yet.
You really are an idiot, aren't you? You dropped it in here when you left. Try not to lose it next time.
Hey! That's not very nice.
I'm not very nice. If you want to see who ruined all of my plans, adventurer, just look in a mirror.
Suit yourself. At least I got a nice amulet for my trouble.
And don't forget who gave it unlimited charges for you!
About that amulet - I might be able to improve it for you, for a fee. Have you got it with you?
No, I don't have it on me at the moment. I must have stored it somewhere.
Of course you did. I bet you spend your life collecting junk, storing it, then complaining you've run out of storage space. Fetch the amulet if you want my help.
Yes, I've got it here.
Yes, it's what I thought. This amulet will run out of charges all the time, if you keep using it. For one million coins I can give it unlimited charges.
Why do you need so much money for it?
Three reasons. Firstly, I'm a Zamorakian mage - we're not big on charity work. Secondly, I want the money. Finally, in case you need reminding, I hate you.
Right. Well, I haven't got that kind of money on me.
Okay, here's one million coins.
I'm not interested.
Your loss.
Maybe another time.

characters.name: Akthanakos
characters.description: Ancient male Mahjarrat, deep and commanding tone with otherworldly resonance. A camel-headed being imprisoned for millennia, speaks with righteous indignation and ancient authority.

characters.name: Boneguard
characters.description: Ancient being, hollow and otherworldly tone. A spirit trapped within an animated skeleton, speaks with desperation and underlying nobility despite forced servitude.

characters.name: Enakhra
characters.description: Ancient female Mahjarrat, sophisticated and bitter tone with dark menace. A powerful sorceress devoted to Zamorak, scorned and vengeful after thousands of years of isolation.

characters.name: Freed Spirit
characters.description: Ethereal and relieved tone. A spirit released from bondage, grateful and fading with otherworldly echoes.

characters.name: Knight
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, formal and dutiful tone. An ancient knight from Avarrocka, noble and military with chivalric bearing.

characters.name: Lazim
characters.description: Middle-aged male, Middle Eastern accent, dismissive and contemptuous tone. A sunburnt Zamorakian mage, sarcastic and arrogant with barely concealed disdain.

characters.name: Pentyn
characters.description: Elderly male, British accent, exhausted and haunted tone. An ancient knight imprisoned for thousands of years, weary and desperate from prolonged torment and hunger.
